channel.title: math.AG updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AG updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On the geometric degree of the tangent bundle of a smooth algebraic variety
item.description: arXiv:2403.10661v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present bounds for the geometric degree of the tangent bundle and the tangential variety of a smooth affine algebraic variety $V$ in terms of the geometric degree of $V$. We first analyze the case of curves, showing an explicit relation between these degrees. In addition, for parametric curves, we obtain upper bounds that are linear in the degree of the given curve. In the case of varieties of arbitrary dimension, we prove general upper bounds for the degrees of the tangent bundle and the tangential variety of $V$ that are exponential in the dimension or co-dimension of $V$, and a quadratic upper bound that holds for varieties defined by generic polynomials. Finally, we characterize the smooth irreducible varieties with a tangent bundle of minimal degree.
item.dc:creator: Gabriela Jeronimo, Leonardo Lanciano, Pablo Solern\'o

item.title: Jacobian elliptic fibrations on K3s with a non-symplectic automorphism of order 3
item.description: arXiv:2403.10712v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We classify elliptic fibrations on elliptic K3 surfaces with a non-symplectic automorphism $\sigma$ of order 3 according to the action of $\sigma$ on their fibres, building on work by Garbagnati and Salgado for non-symplectic involutions. Furthermore, we apply the Kneser--Nishiyama method to such K3 surfaces under the hypothesis that their Picard number is at least 12 and the automorphism $\sigma$ acts trivially on their Ner\'on--Severi group.
item.dc:creator: Felipe Zingali Meira

item.title: Lipschitz normally embedded sets do not need to have Lipschitz normally embedded medial axis
item.description: arXiv:2403.10734v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The aim of this paper is to study the Lipschitz normally embedded property for a set and its medial axis. We consider if and when a non-LNE set implies non-LNE medial axis and converse. We present an example a of Lipschitz normally set that has medial axis which is not Lipschitz normally emebedded. At the end we discuss special case when a set is a one dimensional germ on a plane.
item.dc:creator: Micha{\l} Kosiba

item.title: Smooth Euler-symmetric varieties generated by a single polynomial
item.description: arXiv:2403.10812v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We classify smooth Euler-symmetric varieties corresponding to the symbol system generated by a single reduced polynomial.
item.dc:creator: Cong Ding, Zhijun Luo

item.title: Central motives on parahoric flag varieties
item.description: arXiv:2403.11007v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We construct a refinement of Gaitsgory's central functor for integral motivic sheaves, and show it preserves stratified Tate motives. Towards this end, we develop a reformulation of unipotent motivic nearby cycles, which also works over higher-dimensional bases. We moreover introduce Wakimoto motives and use them to show that our motivic central functor is t-exact. A decategorification of these functors yields a new approach to generic Hecke algebras for general parahorics.
item.dc:creator: Robert Cass, Thibaud van den Hove, Jakob Scholbach

item.title: A-upper motives
item.description: arXiv:2403.11030v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $E/F$ be a finite field extension with every intermediate field being Galois over $F$. Given a reductive group $G$ over $F$ such that $G_E$ is of inner type, we define its A-upper motives. These motives are indecomposable and naturally related with the indecomposable summands in the motives of spectra of intermediate fields in $E/F$. We show that motives of projective homogeneous varieties under $G$ are isomorphic to direct sums of Tate shifts of A-upper motives. Based on that, we get a classification of the motives of projective homogeneous varieties under absolutely simple groups of type not $^6\!D_4$, by means of their higher Artin-Tate traces. We also show how Tits indexes over suitable field extensions determine motivic equivalence classes for these algebraic groups.
item.dc:creator: Charles De Clercq, Nikita Karpenko, Anne Qu\'eguiner-Mathieu

item.title: Cohomologically smooth morphisms for \'etale $\mathbb F_p$-sheaves in characteristic $p$
item.description: arXiv:2403.11149v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We scrutinise the notions of cohomologically smooth morphisms and smooth objects for the six functor formalism of \'etale $\mathbb F_p$-sheaves on schemes in characteristic $p$. We show that only cohomologically \'etale morphisms are cohomologically smooth in this setting. This is complemented by a characterisation of cohomologically \'etale morphisms in arbitrary characteristic. In fact, we prove that such a morphism is already \'etale up to universal homeomorphism.
item.dc:creator: Felix Lotter

item.title: Uniform (d+1)-bundle over the Grassmannian G(d,n)
item.description: arXiv:2403.11231v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper is dedicated to the classification of uniform vector bundles of rank $d+1$ over the Grassmannian $G(d,n)$ ($d\le n-d$) over an algebraically closed field in characteristic $0$. Specifically, we show that all uniform vector bundles with rank $d+1$ over $G(d,n)$ are homogeneous.
item.dc:creator: Rong Du, Yuhang Zhou

item.title: Prismatic crystals and $q$-Higgs fields
item.description: arXiv:2403.11676v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Similarly to the theory of crystalline cohomology, we give a local description of a prismatic crystal and its cohomology in terms of a $q$-Higgs module and the associated $q$-Higgs complex on the bounded prismatic envelope of an embedding into a framed smooth algebra, when the base bounded prism is defined over the $q$-crystalline prism. We also discuss its behavior under the scalar extension by the Frobenius lifting and tensor products, and a global description of the cohomology of a prismatic crystal via Zariski cohomological descent.
item.dc:creator: Takeshi Tsuji

item.title: The Gersten conjecture for $p$-adic \'etale Tate twists and the $p$-adic cycle class map
item.description: arXiv:2403.11853v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove the Gersten conjecture for $p$-adic \'etale Tate twists for a smooth scheme $X$ in mixed characteristic. Furthermore, we revisit the cycle class map from thickened zero-cycles on the special fiber of $X$ to \'etale cohomology with coefficients in $p$-adic \'etale Tate twists previously studied in [13]. The approach we use in this article is more conceptual and works in greater generality.
item.dc:creator: Morten L\"uders

item.title: A modular ramified geometric Satake equivalence
item.description: arXiv:2403.10651v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We extend the ramified geometric Satake equivalence due to Zhu (for tamely ramified groups) and the third named author (in full generality) from rational coefficients to include modular and integral coefficients.
item.dc:creator: Pramod N. Achar, Jo\~ao Louren\c{c}o, Timo Richarz, Simon Riche

item.title: On the Piatetski-Shapiro construction for integral models of Shimura varieties
item.description: arXiv:2403.10653v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We study the Piatetski-Shapiro construction, which takes a totally real field F and a Shimura datum (G,X) and produces a new Shimura datum (H,Y). If F is Galois, then the Galois group Gamma of F acts on (H,Y), and we show that the Gamma-fixed points of the Shimura varieties for (H,Y) recover the Shimura varieties for (G,X) under some hypotheses. For Shimura varieties of Hodge type with parahoric level, we show that the same is true for the p-adic integral models constructed by Pappas--Rapoport, if p is unramified in F. We also study the Gamma-fixed points of the Igusa stacks of Zhang for (H,Y) and prove optimal results.
item.dc:creator: Pol van Hoften, Jack Sempliner

item.title: Order-One Rolling Shutter Cameras
item.description: arXiv:2403.11295v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Rolling shutter (RS) cameras dominate consumer and smartphone markets. Several methods for computing the absolute pose of RS cameras have appeared in the last 20 years, but the relative pose problem has not been fully solved yet. We provide a unified theory for the important class of order-one rolling shutter (RS$_1$) cameras. These cameras generalize the perspective projection to RS cameras, projecting a generic space point to exactly one image point via a rational map. We introduce a new back-projection RS camera model, characterize RS$_1$ cameras, construct explicit parameterizations of such cameras, and determine the image of a space line. We classify all minimal problems for solving the relative camera pose problem with linear RS$_1$ cameras and discover new practical cases. Finally, we show how the theory can be used to explain RS models previously used for absolute pose computation.
item.dc:creator: Marvin Anas Hahn, Kathl\'en Kohn, Orlando Marigliano, Tomas Pajdla

item.title: On the height of the universal abelian variety
item.description: arXiv:2403.11745v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this paper we extend the arithmetic intersection theory of adelic divisors on quasiprojective varieties developed by X. Yuan and S. W. Zhang to cover certain adelic arithmetic divisors that are not nef nor integrable. The key concept used in this extension is the relative finite energy introduced by T. Darvas, E. Di Nezza, and C. H. Lu. As an application we compute the arithmetic self-intersection number of the line bundle of Siegel-Jacobi forms on the universal abelian variety endowed with its invariant hermitian metric. The techniques developed in this paper can be applied in many other situations like mixed Shimura varieties or the moduli space of stable marked curves.
item.dc:creator: Jos\'e Ignacio Burgos Gil, J\"urg Kramer

item.title: Grothendieck-Katz conjecture
item.description: arXiv:2403.11829v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this article we prove that linear differential equations with only algebraic solutions have zero $m$-curvature modulo $p^k$ for all except a finite number of primes $p$ and all $k,m\in\mathbb N$ with ${\rm ord}_pm!\geq k$. This provides us with a reformulation of Grothendieck-Katz conjecture with stronger hypothesis.
item.dc:creator: Hossein Movasati

item.title: On Isomorphisms of Grassmann Spaces
item.description: arXiv:1204.3191v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We exhibit isomorphisms of Grassmann spaces and their relationship with collineations and embeddings of the underlying projective spaces.
item.dc:creator: Hans Havlicek

item.title: Loops on schemes and the algebraic fundamental group
item.description: arXiv:2109.11364v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this note we give a re-interpretation of the algebraic fundamental group for proper schemes that is rather close to the original definition of the fundamental group for topological spaces. The idea is to replace the standard interval from topology by what we call interval schemes. This leads to an algebraic version of continuous loops, and the homotopy relation is defined in terms of the monodromy action. Our main results hinge on Macaulayfication for proper schemes and Lefschetz type results.
item.dc:creator: Kay R\"ulling, Stefan Schr\"oer

item.title: Mirror Symmetry for log Calabi-Yau Surfaces II
item.description: arXiv:2201.12703v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We show that the ring of regular functions of every smooth affine log Calabi-Yau surface with maximal boundary has a vector space basis parametrized by its set of integer tropical points and a $\mathbb{C}$-algebra structure with structure coefficients given by the geometric construction of Keel-Yu. To prove this result, we first give a canonical compactification of the mirror family associated with a pair $(Y,D)$ constructed by Gross-Hacking-Keel where $Y$ is a smooth projective rational surface, $D$ is an anti-canonical cycle of rational curves and $Y\setminus D$ is the minimal resolution of an affine surface with, at worst, du Val singularities. Then, we compute periods for the compactified family using techniques from work of Ruddat-Siebert and use this to give a modular interpretation of the compactified mirror family.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lai, Yan Zhou

item.title: p-adic iterated integration on semistable curves
item.description: arXiv:2202.05340v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We reformulate the theory of p-adic iterated integrals on semistable curves using the unipotent log rigid fundamental group. This fundamental group carries Frobenius and monodromy operators whose basic properties are established. By identifying the Frobenius-invariant subgroup of the fundamental group with the fundamental group of the dual graph, we characterize Berkovich--Coleman integration, which is path-dependent, as integration along the Frobenius-invariant lift of a path in the dual graph. We demonstrate the basic properties for this integration theory. Vologodsky's path-independent integration theory which was previously described using a monodromy condition can now be identified as Berkovich--Coleman integration along a combinatorial canonical path arising from the theory of combinatorial iterated integration as developed by the first-named author and Cheng. We use this definition to lay the groundwork for computing iterated integrals.
item.dc:creator: Eric Katz, Daniel Litt

item.title: On k-rational and k-Du Bois local complete intersections
item.description: arXiv:2207.08743v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We show that k-rational singularities of local complete intersections are k-Du Bois. For hypersurfaces, we characterize k-rationality in terms of the minimal exponent. We also establish some local vanishing results for k-rational and k-Du Bois singularities. Some of these results have been independently obtained in [FL2].
item.dc:creator: Mircea Mustata, Mihnea Popa

item.title: On the Linear AFL: The Non-Basic Case
item.description: arXiv:2208.10144v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The linear Arithmetic Fundamental Lemma (AFL) conjecture compares intersection numbers on Lubin--Tate deformation spaces with derivatives of orbital integrals. It has been introduced for elliptic orbits in arXiv:1803.07553 and arXiv:2010.07365. In these cases, the relevant intersection problem is formulated for the basic isogeny class. In the present article, we extend the theory to all orbits and all isogeny classes. Our main result is a reduction of the non-basic cases of the AFL to the basic ones, which is achieved by exploiting the connected-\'etale sequence. Our theory will be relevant in the global setting, where also locally non-elliptic orbits may contribute in a non-trivial way.
item.dc:creator: Qirui Li, Andreas Mihatsch

item.title: Descent of tautological sheaves from Hilbert schemes to Enriques manifolds
item.description: arXiv:2212.04467v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Let $X$ be a K3 surface which doubly covers an Enriques surface $S$. If $n\in\mathbb{N}$ is an odd number, then the Hilbert scheme of $n$-points $X^{[n]}$ admits a natural quotient $S_{[n]}$. This quotient is an Enriques manifold in the sense of Oguiso and Schr\"oer. In this paper we construct slope stable sheaves on $S_{[n]}$ and study some of their properties.
item.dc:creator: Fabian Reede

item.title: A stacky approach to identifying the semistable locus of bundles
item.description: arXiv:2302.09245v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We show that the semistable locus is the unique maximal open substack of the moduli stack of principal bundles over a curve that admits a schematic moduli space. For rank $2$ vector bundles it coincides with the unique maximal open substack that admits a separated moduli space, but for higher rank there exist other open substacks that admit separated moduli spaces.
item.dc:creator: Dario Weissmann, Xucheng Zhang

item.title: Natural real algebraic maps of non-positive codimensions with prescribed images whose boundaries consist of non-singular real algebraic hypersurfaces satisfying transversality
item.description: arXiv:2303.10723v5 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We present new real algebraic maps of non-positive codimensions with prescribed images whose boundaries consist of explicit non-singular real algebraic hypersurfaces satisfying so-called "transversality". We also give explicit information on important real polynomials. This gives new construction of explicit real algebraic maps of non-positive codimensions with explicit information on images, preimages and important real polynomials. Thanks to celebrated theory of Nash and Tognoli, smooth closed manifolds are non-singular real algebraic manifolds and the zero sets of some real polynomial maps. In considerable cases, we can approximate smooth functions or more generally, maps, by real algebraic ones. It is in general difficult to have explicit examples. We have constructed some previously. We have ones of some new type with explicit information on global structures of the maps.
item.dc:creator: Naoki Kitazawa

item.title: Dicritical foliations and semiroots of plane branches
item.description: arXiv:2304.01047v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this work we describe dicritical foliations in $(\mathbb{C}^2,0)$ at a triple point of the resolution dual graph of an analytic plane branch $\mathcal{C}$ using its semiroots. In particular, we obtain a constructive method to present a one-parameter family $\mathcal{C}_{u}$ of separatrices for such foliations. As a by-product we relate the contact order between a special member of $\mathcal{C}_{u}$ and $\mathcal{C}$ with analytic discrete invariants of plane branches.
item.dc:creator: Nuria Corral, Marcelo E. Hernandes, Maria Elenice R. Hernandes

item.title: On the Gille theorem for the relative projective line: I
item.description: arXiv:2304.09465v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We prove a relative version of a theorem on torsors on the projective line due to Philippe Gille. As a consequence we obtain a ``weak homotopy invariance'' result for torsors under reductive group schemes defined over arbitrary semi-local regular domains. Specifically, only regular semi-local domains with infinite residue fields are regarded in this preprint. However, all results of the present preprint are true (after minor modifications) for arbitrary semi-local regular domains. This will be the topic of our next preprint.
item.dc:creator: Ivan Panin, Anastasia Stavrova

item.title: On local delta invariant of del Pezzo surfaces
item.description: arXiv:2304.12286v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We complete the classification of local stability thresholds for smooth del Pezzo surfaces of degree~2. In particular, we show that this number is irrational if and only if a unique (-1)-curve passes through the point where we are computing the local invariant.
item.dc:creator: Erroxe Etxabarri Alberdi

item.title: On the Gille theorem for the relative projective line
item.description: arXiv:2305.16627v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We prove a relative version of a theorem on torsors on the projective line due to Philippe Gille.
item.dc:creator: Ivan Panin, Anastasia Stavrova

item.title: Formal schemes and infinitesimal neighbourhoods
item.description: arXiv:2305.18813v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The aim of this article is to give a rigorous geometric interpretation of the completion of a ring with respect to an ideal. To this end, we define the infinitesimal neighbourhood of an immersion of formal schemes as the largest possible thickening. Further, we show that immersions of formal schemes locally of formal finite presentation admit the existence of infinitesimal neighbourhoods, which are locally given by completing with respect to an ideal.
item.dc:creator: Federico Bongiorno

item.title: On the Lau group scheme
item.description: arXiv:2307.06194v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In a 2013 article, Eike Lau constructed a canonical morphism from the stack of $n$-truncated Barsotti-Tate groups over $F_p$ to the stack of n-truncated displays. He also proved that this morphism is a gerbe banded by a commutative group scheme. This e-print is a step towards an explicit description of this group scheme.
item.dc:creator: Vladimir Drinfeld

item.title: Desingularization of generic symmetric and generic skew-symmetric determinantal singularities
item.description: arXiv:2308.01460v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We discuss how to resolve generic skew-symmetric and generic symmetric determinantal singularities. The key ingredients are (skew-) symmetry preserving matrix operations in order to deduce an inductive argument.
item.dc:creator: Sabrina Alexandra Gaube, Bernd Schober

item.title: Toward Shimurian analogs of Barsotti-Tate groups
item.description: arXiv:2309.02346v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We first recall Grothendieck's notion of n-truncated Barsotti-Tate group. Such groups form an algebraic stack over the integers. The problem is to give an illuminating description of its reductions modulo powers of p. A related problem is to construct analogs of these reductions related to general Shimura varieties with good reduction at p. We discuss some conjectures on this subject based on the theory of prismatic cohomology.
item.dc:creator: Vladimir Drinfeld

item.title: The Two Lives of the Grassmannian
item.description: arXiv:2401.03684v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The real Grassmannian is both a projective variety (via Pl\"ucker coordinates) and an affine variety (via orthogonal projections). We connect these two representations, and we develop the commutative algebra of the latter variety. We introduce the squared Grassmannian, and we study applications to determinantal point processes in statistics.
item.dc:creator: Karel Devriendt, Hannah Friedman, Bernhard Reinke, Bernd Sturmfels

item.title: Arithmetic Fujita approximation over adelic curves
item.description: arXiv:2401.15271v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper, we will prove an analogue of Fujita's approximation theorem under the framework of Arakelov theory over adelic curves, which proves a conjecture of Huayi Chen and Atsushi Moriwaki.
item.dc:creator: Chunhui Liu

item.title: Equations of genus $4$ curves from their theta constants
item.description: arXiv:2402.03160v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this article we give explicit formulas for the equations of a generic genus $4$ curve in terms of its theta constants. The method uses the Prym construction and the beautiful classical geometry around it.
item.dc:creator: Jeroen Hanselman, Andreas Pieper, Sam Schiavone

item.title: Principles of Locally Conformally Kahler Geometry
item.description: arXiv:2208.07188v5 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: An LCK (locally conformally Kahler) manifold is a complex manifold admitting a Kahler covering with monodromy acting by homotheties. Hopf manifolds and their submanifolds are the prime examples. This book presents an introduction to the principles of LCK geometry (the first two parts) and its current situation (the last part). It is supposed to be accessible to master and graduate students of complex geometry. The book contains many exercises of different levels of difficulty. We finish it by a list of open questions.
item.dc:creator: Liviu Ornea, Misha Verbitsky

item.title: WDVV-based recursion for open Gromov-Witten invariants
item.description: arXiv:2402.10542v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We give a computability result for open Gromov-Witten invariants based on open WDVV equations. This is analogous to the result of Kontsevich-Manin for closed Gromov-Witten invariants. For greater generality, we base the argument on a formal object, the Frobenius superpotential, that generalizes several different definitions of open Gromov-Witten invariants. As an application, we prove vanishing properties for open Gromov-Witten invariants on products of projective spaces.
item.dc:creator: Roi Blumberg, Sara B. Tukachinsky

item.title: The minimum distance of a parameterized code over an even cycle
item.description: arXiv:2403.05445v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We compute the minimum distance of the parameterized code of order 1 over an even cycle.
item.dc:creator: Eduardo Camps-Moreno, Jorge Neves, Eliseo Sarmiento
